Detailed Description

This modules define API to configure and control external video encoders like HDMI transmitters. Typically the external video encoders interface to the host via one of the DPI ports. I2C is used to send control commands to the video encoder.

User application controls and configures the video encoder and based on this in turn configures the DPI ports.

The following video encoder's are currently supported

  • SII9022a - HDMI HD transmitter

The API interface used in the FVID2 interface (See also FVID2 API)

The following FVID2 APIs are supported by video encoder device drivers,

  • Creating the driver - Fvid2_create()
    Parameter Value
    drvId FVID2_VID_ENC_SII9022A_DRV
    instanceId Set to 0
    createArgs Bsp_VidEncCreateParams *
    createStatusArgs Bsp_VidEncCreateStatus *
    cbParams NOT USED, Set to NULL.
    Fvid2_Handle returned by Fvid2_create() is used in subsequent FVID2 APIs
  • Deleting the driver - Fvid2_delete()
    Parameter Value
    deleteArgs NOT USED, set to NULL
  • Starting the driver - Fvid2_start()
    Parameter Value
    cmdArgs NOT USED, set to NULL
  • Stopping the driver - Fvid2_stop()
    Parameter Value
    cmdArgs NOT USED, set to NULL
  • Controlling the driver - Fvid2_control()
    See BSP_DRV_IOCTL_DEVICE_VID_ENC for the list of IOCTLs supported by the driver.
    All supported video encoders implement these IOCTLs.

    • SII9022A supports further additional specific IOCTLs (See SII9022A Video Encoder API)
